snippet: The El Paso Corporation said it pushed back the meeting by a few days, to allow shareholders to weigh a Delaware judge's criticism of the process that led to the company's $21.1 billion sale to Kinder Morgan.
abstract: The El Paso Corporation said it pushed back the meeting by a few days, to allow shareholders to weigh a Delaware judge's criticism of the process that led to the company's $21.1 billion sale to Kinder Morgan.

byline.original: By MICHAEL J. DE LA MERCED

headline.main: El Paso Delays Vote on Kinder Morgan Deal by a Few Days
